timeline.message: Add tests for alternate feature names support
Add tests for alternate feature names support
Add tests for alternate feature names support

timeline.author: tjwatson

replies.author: sebratton

timeline.bodyText: I suggest making this a Collection<String> to give more freedom in the implementation.  Likely an ArrayList would be more performant than requiring a heavy object like a Set here.
timeline.author: tjwatson
tjwatson

timeline.bodyText: if you change to writeInt be sure to change this to readInt
timeline.author: tjwatson

timeline.bodyText: might as well seed the size here for the collection.  If this is an ArrayList that would make it pretty small.  Should consider using Collections.empty for when size == 0
timeline.author: tjwatson

timeline.bodyText:
If we do ignore case here then we need to do the following to populate:
alternateFeatureNameToPublicName.put(lowerFeature(s), cachedAttr.featureName);
timeline.author: tjwatson

replies.bodyText: I am surprised the FATs pass without making the change to lower case the key here.
replies.author: tjwatson

replies.bodyText: Will do the lowerFeature call in FeatureDefinitionUtils.getAltNames() instead.
replies.author: sebratton

timeline.bodyText: Other places that write a collection use writeInt for the size.  I agree that it is far fetched to ever need that big of a size for alternate names, but I'd error on the side of consistency here.
timeline.author: tjwatson

timeline.bodyText:
We likely need to ignore case here like we do for short names:
return alternateFeatureNameToPublicName.get(lowerFeature(featureName));
timeline.author: tjwatson

timeline.bodyText: {0} appears to be a feature, not a feature definition. If so, change "the feature definition {0} which was not found." to "the {0} feature that was not found." If (0) applies to a feature definition, then use ""the {0} feature definition that was not found."
timeline.author: helyarp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -217,6 +217,11 @@ UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_DIFFERENT_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0044E: Th
 UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_DIFFERENT_PLATFORM_ERROR.explanation=The server configuration contains an incompatible combination of both Jakarta EE and Java EE features.  Features that support the Jakarta EE 9 programming model are incompatible with features that support the Java EE programming models, including Jakarta EE 8.  This conflict can happen if the two incompatible features are configured directly in the server configuration, or if the configured features include different versions of a feature that are incompatible.
 UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_DIFFERENT_PLATFORM_ERROR.useraction=Specify a compatible version of the configured features that caused the conflict in the server.xml file, and ensure the server.xml file uses either Jakarta EE or Java EE features, but not both.
 
+#CWWK0045E {0} = feature appearing in server xml; {1} = a real feature def name which is a probable match for name 0.
+MISSING_FEATURE_HAS_ALT_NAME=CWWKF0045E: An existing feature definition, {1}, is a possible match for the feature definition {0} which was not found.

timeline.bodyText: Change "could not" to "cannot" and change "may" to "might"
timeline.author: helyarp

@@ -217,6 +217,11 @@ UPDATE_CONFLICT_INCOMPATIBLE_EE_FEATURES_DIFFERENT_PLATFORM_ERROR=CWWKF0044E: Th

This conflict can happen if the two incompatible features are configured directly in the server configuration, or if the configured features include different versions of a feature that are incompatible.

+MISSING_FEATURE_HAS_ALT_NAME.explanation=The feature manager could not find a definition for a feature specified in the server configuration. The name specified may match an existing feature definition.

timeline.bodyText: Change "the feature {0} which" to  "the {0} feature that"  or to "the {0} feature, which"

replies.bodyText: latest message change has been pushed to github
replies.author: sebratton

timeline.message: Address the latest message review comment

Check for alternate feature names and log new related error message.

Additional meta-data can be added to a feature definition for commonly known
alternate names. If a configured feature is not found during a feature
configuration update and it matches a known alternate name, then an error
message will be issued with the real name of the feature as a hint.

closes https://github.com/OpenLiberty/open-liberty/issues/13393

Update feature definitions with alternate name metadata

Updated feature existing at time of commit.
Add tests for alternate feature names support
Addresses code and message review comments
Address the latest message review comment
Update additional feature manifests with new header
Update additional feature manifests with new header
